ENGLISH: A mountain that has been sculpted into Durin's form by the Greatest Dwarven cutters.
The Main gate has been reinforced with timber.
The Main gate has been reinforced with timber and some stone.
In addition the the reinforced gate, slits in the walls for archers have been added.
Crenulations are built, expanding on the archer slits.
In addition the the reinforced gate and crenulations, 2 small towers have been added to the gate.
In addition the the reinforced gate and crenulations, the small towers have been expanded upon.
In addition the the reinforced gate, crenulations, and towers, the outer grounds have been laced with small traps.
In addition the the reinforced gate, crenulations, towers, and traps, the outer grounds have been configured with large siege structures.
In addition the the reinforced gate, crenulations, towers, traps, and seige structures, a moat and draw bridge have been constructed.
The reinforced gate, crenulations, towers, traps, and seige structures, moat, and draw bridge have all been expertly crafted by Dwarves.
The mountain has been locked down by master Dwarven engineers, not even 20 good men could take it.

The Men-i-Naugrim , also known as the Dwarf Road,  Old Forest Road or Thurkhbinnt in Khuzdul, is the main route through the great forest of Greenwood. Of the origins of the Road little is known, The Dwarves had a tradition of road-building dating back to before the First Age, and it seems that they must have built the Forest Road to carry traffic between their western and eastern clans.
This portion of the Men-i-Naugrim has been abandoned for too long.

The Doom Road, also named Sauron's Road, is a road that connects the Orodruin with the sorrounding lands. It rises about 4500 feet with its base about 3000 feet tall. The Road approaches the east side of the base and then goes up like a snake. This road needs constant repairs from Mt. Dooms eruptions.
FRENCH: The Doom Road, also named Sauron's Road, is a road that connects the Orodruin with the sorrounding lands.  It rises about 4500 feet with its base about 3000 feet tall. The Road approaches the east side of the base and then goes up like a snake. This road needs constant repairs from Mt. Dooms eruptions.

ENGLISH: The Great East Road was originally laid by the dwarves during the First Age before the first rising of the Sun, probably during the last Age of Stars, and ran from the Iron Hills through Rhovanion to Khazad-dm, from which it continued across Eriador to the Ered Luin, and then on into Doriath in Beleriand. The western parts were built to facilitate the passage of companies of dwarf craftsmen (and later, their armed escort) across eastern Beleriand, before the Sack of Doriath by the dwarfs of Nogrod ended their trade.
The Greenway is the northernmost portion of an ancient road which was meant to connect Arnor with Gondor.
The Old South Road is the dunlending portion of an ancient road which was meant to connect Arnor with Gondor
Ruins of the Old South Road
Ruins of the Old South Road
The Old South Road is the dunlending portion of an ancient road which was meant to connect Arnor with Gondor
The Great West Road is a portion of an ancient road which was meant to connect Arnor with Gondor. It starts at Isengard and the Fords of Isen and goes to Minas Tirith and Osgiliath
The South Road is the southernmost portion of an ancient road which was meant to connect Arnor with Gondor
This great road used to connect Minas Tirith, Osgiliath, and Minas Ithil
The Harad Road was the long road that connected Ithilien and Harad.
There is nothing for men, elves or dwarves here... yet.
